decision_conditions: The specification is not suitable and therefore needs to be confirmed. The specification needs to be measurable and quantifiable so that we can understand the amount that is to be removed in metres. We need to know the amount to be removed and the remaining crown size. E.g. 2m crown reduction in width and 2m reduction in height, leaving a canopy spread of 3m and height of 5m.
description:
T1 Horse Chestnut: Lateral reduction back to boundary 
Reasons: The tree’s crown has extended significantly beyond the boundary line, resulting in a loss of light, space, and usable garden area for the applicant’s property. A lateral reduction will restore balance and mitigate ongoing intrusion without compromising the health or form of the tree. Current Height 14m - no change to height during works - Current Lateral spread (circumference 6m) - over client side 6m. Lateral spread after works 3m.
